text: hey <!here> I am wondering about iusng export_to_template_context with advanced menu.. any ideas?
What's the use case, putting the same menu in multiple places?
I wanted to output the menu as a variable so I could run |replace on it
I am having to create 31 menus. one for every language. If i could run replace i could replace the menu names

What's the value in using the built-in menu setup / tools? honestly curious... I've done very little with menus in the interface... My immediate thought would be to just create a menu file with dicts for each language and menu structure... then @import it as a macro then replace menu language in the templates based on the language code (could be grabbed from a variable set on the template or via a HubSpot internal variable i'd imagine)
You may even be able to set each menu in the macro file and return the reference to the correct one in the same manner
instead of milling over it for hours i just duplicated the menu 31 times. Sucks but I can update it with a better solution in the future.
Yeah, <@U4RP6AGV9> I think that is a better way
